title: We all agree we hate Fizz right?
body: Not saying he's OP... even when he's UP.... like... we ALL hate that guy right?

replies.body: Eh... While he's his own special brand of annoying, he's nowhere near as bad as he was when people were still building bruiser Fizz. Seriously, fuck that shit, at least AP Fizz actually dies if you manage to CC him.
Season 4 Fizz was fun. He just hit level 2 and 100-0 you with nothing but a Flask. If he couldn't kill you pre-6 he was guranteed to kill you post-6.
I love assassins but absolutely hate Fizz and Leblanc.

Fizz is ok to deal with. At least you can counterplay him.

Leblanc is a different story. Safest mid laner in the game.
{{champion:238}} excuse me?

Leblanc is better than zed at the safety game imo. Her W travels about the same distance, but it has a much lower cooldown, and she can mimic it with her ult and go a really far distance in a really short amount of time.
can she throw out Q's for days without running out of mana?
Actually there's little to no counterplay for Fizz. Take that 5% mastery and your E will always be up. Get Zhonyas and chances are you'll never die in that game unless you are greedy.
There is more counterplay to Fizz than there is Leblanc at least.
Can't argue with that but when you have a skill resembling Zhonyas every 4-6 seconds, I don't know what counterplay there is.
Fair enough, I think that's why early game is the most crucial point to shut Fizz down or else his late game will bite you way too hard.
Hey bud. Fizz haz 0 waveclear and with proper warding struggles to make picks when behind. That's your counterplay.
His waveclear with Maxed E + Lich Bane is pretty decent. Wipes out the caster minions. Better than LB waveclear.

Hello? Melee range waveclear is shit in sieges. If he needs to use his e and a lich bane to wave clear, you can just blow him up. It's why lb is shit in most sieges, she has to put herself at immense risk for the waveclear. E+lich bane isn't viable wave clear because it will get you killed in a siege.
considering it ahs a 4 second cooldown and he also has a dash on his w, IDK if its as much risk as you are saying.
First off, dash is on his q. Second off, that's 4 seconds of him being up in front of minions with no untargateability that you can fucking destroy him in.

> [{quoted}](name=KillerMan2219,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JQj18ATh,comment-id=00040000000100020000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-10T20:30:13.685+0000)
>
> First off, dash is on his q. Second off, that's 4 seconds of him being up in front of minions with no untargateability that you can fucking destroy him in.

Oh no! 4 whole seconds without one of your two mobility moves! Woe is me!

That's IF he's stupid enough to use it when all your abilities are up (or even just your cc ones). 4 seconds is a super short cd, let alone for mobility moves that make you untargetable.

I swear it's like you people don't think about practical game theory. He needs to either let the wave get shoved in and his tower get chunked, or put himself at risk of death by clearing the wave. Roam mid before he has an assload of items, start a siege, he can't stop it.

Except one item IS an assload of items here.

Plus, your "game theory" doesn't work when you...
A. Can't go near him without trading
B. Can't ever win a trade
C. Can't catch him
D. Die in 3 hits.
Who said anything about sieges? You just brought that up now. Why would Fizz farm during Sieges?

Uuuuuuh. I figured they didn't need to be mentioned since they are a core part of the game. Either way, he can't farm during sieges, that's the point. He can't clear waves when they get shoved into him safely during a siege, meaning the turret gets chipped for free. You just need to play the map differently against him.

Man but then again, who seiges against Fizz? He can easily go in and get a kill. Also you are at risk of getting flanked so it's not really a smart move. The only way to counter fizz is for him not to get kills, which is practically impossible.

People who want to win. You play safe, you have a frontline in front to prevent the engage.

Also flanking really? If you don't have fucking garbage wards that isn't an issue. You play the long game with siege comps, and you smother them out of map control. Play corki-ziggs, or corki-ezreal, or ezreal-ziggs, really easy ways to siege safely against fizz. If you let him run right at you can kill you, you deserve to lose.

Play safe? How can you siege....and play safe at the same time? You are pretty much setting up a teamfight. Also, Since when did Fizz give 2 fcks about your frontline? He can engage with ult, Jump on your squishy and Zhonyas while his team cleans up.

You obviously haven't seen the vision changes. There are less wards on the map now and you can be flanked from the FoW. It happens. Ziggs against Fizz? Pls. Ez, Corki? Puhleaseeeee! Fizz is that champion that sticks to you if he sets his mind to it.

Also fizz has a team, meaning he can also siege but in this case, he'll dive and come out losing only 10 hp.

Jesus. Really? Ok, I guess I gotta explain it like I do to my sub-30 friends.

When you are sieging you can still be safe from a melee range assassin such as fizz. It's called watching zones of control and hitting him with poke so he cannot engage. You whittle the team down safely and keep putting waves into their turret. It will add up and they will be forced to either back off or take a bad fight you can win. 

The vision changes, really? K. Your support still has 3 wards plus a pink, your adc will have blue trinket plus a pink, your jungler can easily have trackers knife or sightstone plus a pink, and your mid/top should also have pinks. WIth proper preplanning that's MORE than enough wards. Also, for sieges, mid laners are typically core, since they have some of the best potential for waveclear typically, with adcs following suit. You need a strong siege mid and adc for it to work, which fizz isn't. 

If you can't stay away from fizz as ezral or corki you have royally fucked up as is. Fizz is not an all powerful god, if you play your ranges smartly and land your poke you can prevent him from doing shit and lock him down. All it takes is preplanning instead of flashy mechanical outplays which everyone on the boards seems to want to do 24/7.

Again you are factoring variables not initially stated. I can't do this. This isn't how debates are held. Lay down the variables instead of adding them at your convenience. 

Also this:
Ok, I guess I gotta explain it like I do to my sub-30 friends.

Is just sad. You achieved nothing by adding that.

Holy shit you got my condolences with all these people here bitching about fizz, but you manage to bring up valid and real arguments instead of shooting your computer. Glad these people still exist :)

Rito should make it so that Fizz has a 25% chance to slip up when he uses playfull trickster and then he lands on his trident and impales his face rooting him in place and bleeding to death over 30 minutes
On the note of his Playful Trickster, why doesn't Poppy's W stop either parts of the dash? Because fuck you apparently.
It's because he's untargetable. Similar reasoning is why she can't stop Rek'Sai ultimate or other champs that become untargetable.

To be fair, Rek'Sai's ultimate moves underground so it isn't like Poppy can dig her shield up in there to stop the monster, but Playful Trickster definitely isn't a blink, which breaks the intended rule of Poppy's W. The animation also clearly lasts longer than his actual window of invulnerability so it should be stopped either at the start or the end - not outright ignore it =/

Except that's not how league thinks about Rek'Sai's ultimate. It's the same as being able to take Tristana out of the air if you hit her with a hook mid-jump. League doesn't operate on different levels even though it may look like it does.

Playful Trickster makes Fizz untargetable for the duration of the skill, meaning that it can go through Poppy's W. That's how the interaction should work according to League's basic design.
Bard can travel through space and time with his w but can still be CCd while in it..

> To be fair, Rek'Sai's ultimate moves underground so it isn't like Poppy can dig her shield up in there to stop the monster

Uh... Rek Sai's E though, just saying.

Fizz is such a rewarding low skill champ. And i dont like him for that, no matter how funny it is to beat one up, or beat up others with Fizz.

He is not super fun, he is barely fun. But the Youtube vids about Fizz are hilarious. The new meta really made him weak af.

But there are Assassins i hate more. Talon, way easier to use, and so freaking rewarding and OP.
Yi, because you see him so much in low elo (even when you know how to punish a Yi player, they are still annoying to see every other game XD).

I don't.   Only time I dislike him is when he is excessively strong to the point of being a contested pick/ban, because that means his play pattern has reached the point of not being "If" he is going to be able to reach you, to "Yes, I am reaching you.  Do you have 3 other champions trying to save your ass?"

I had never felt as raped as after this game. We won, but my brain is shutting down from pain..

Fizz dealt 1k damage with his Q alone (no sheen/TLD/anything, just raw Q). And another 1k from his pole.
People already hate Yasuo, Lee, and Yi.

Leblanc takes damage during her W.
gl hitting that fucking racecar going 160 mph before it nukes you for half of your health

It's actually not hard at all to hit her with skillshots since she needs to hit with W to get kills early, and W always makes her travel in a straight line toward you. 

So if you play any of these:

{{champion:103}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:4}} 

It shouldn't be too hard to disrupt her combo. She's most problematic when you're standing right behind your minions because she can combo you through the wave, but you can't stop her through the wave. 

If you stand to the side, you do have to dodge Es, but if she tries to W, she will lose the trade or the kill unless fed.

EDIT:  I suck with LeBlanc, so I'm just sharing how people beat me. I don't like playing against her either, but I play Teemo and just ignore her until she starts getting crushed by shrooms.

A lot of people just seem reluctant to actually trade with her. They lose half their health and shy away without realizing that during and immediately after her combo is when she's most vulnerable (and she's also exceedingly fragile). If you respect her early kill potential and her power spike at level 6 then it's not too hard to survive against her. Unfortunately, everyone is so fixated on killing her. Just accept she has a very safe design and take advantage of her weakenesses. :/
